DataElement.preferredName: Nicotine Product Past Use Smoking Product Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Kind of specific product previously used that contains nicotine, an addictive substance found in tobacco plants and tobacco products.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A plant alkaloid, found in the tobacco plant, and addictive central nervous system (CNS) stimulant that causes either ganglionic stimulation in low doses or ganglionic blockage in high doses. Nicotine acts as an agonist at the nicotinic cholinergic receptors in the autonomic ganglia, at neuromuscular junctions, and in the adrenal medulla and the brain. Nicotine's CNS-stimulating activities may be mediated through the release of several neurotransmitters, including acetylcholine, beta-endorphin, dopamine, norepinephrine, serotonin, and ACTH. As a result, peripheral vasoconstriction, tachycardia, and elevated blood pressure may be observed with nicotine intake. This agent may also stimulate the chemoreceptor trigger zone, thereby inducing nausea and vomiting._The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced._Before the present time._To put into action or service.
